tool.name: SAGA.imagery_vigra.10
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayFEATURES True isArrayPRESENCE False isArrayRF_IMPORT False isArrayRF_EXPORT False output_data_PREDICTION $output_data_PREDICTION output_data_PROBABILITY $output_data_PROBABILITY name SAGA.imagery_vigra.10 FEATURES $FEATURES PRESENCE $PRESENCE BACKGROUND $BACKGROUND DO_MRMR $DO_MRMR mRMR_NFEATURES $mRMR_NFEATURES mRMR_DISCRETIZE $mRMR_DISCRETIZE mRMR_THRESHOLD $mRMR_THRESHOLD mRMR_METHOD $mRMR_METHOD RF_IMPORT $RF_IMPORT RF_EXPORT $RF_EXPORT RF_TREE_COUNT $RF_TREE_COUNT RF_TREE_SAMPLES $RF_TREE_SAMPLES RF_REPLACE $RF_REPLACE RF_SPLIT_MIN_SIZE $RF_SPLIT_MIN_SIZE RF_NODE_FEATURES $RF_NODE_FEATURES RF_STRATIFICATION $RF_STRATIFICATION prefer $prefer response $response outputType_PREDICTION $OutputSection_PREDICTION.outputType_PREDICTION transmissionMode_PREDICTION $OutputSection_PREDICTION.transmissionMode_PREDICTION outputType_PROBABILITY $OutputSection_PROBABILITY.outputType_PROBABILITY transmissionMode_PROBABILITY $OutputSection_PROBABILITY.transmissionMode_PROBABILITY

param.name: FEATURES
param.label: Features
param.help: Features The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff

param.name: PRESENCE
param.label: Presence Data
param.help: Presence Data The following data types are allowed in the txt file: json, xml, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: DO_MRMR
param.label: Minimum Redundancy Feature Selection
param.help: Use only features selected by the minimum Redundancy Maximum Relevance (mRMR) algorithm

param.name: mRMR_DISCRETIZE
param.label: Discretization
param.help: uncheck this means no discretizaton (i.e. data is already integer)

param.name: mRMR_THRESHOLD
param.label: Discretization Threshold
param.help: a double number of the discretization threshold; set to 0 to make binarization

param.name: RF_IMPORT
param.label: Import from File
param.help: Import from File The following data types are allowed in the txt file: plain

param.name: RF_EXPORT
param.label: Export to File
param.help: Export to File The following data types are allowed in the txt file: plain

param.name: RF_TREE_SAMPLES
param.label: Samples per Tree
param.help: Specifies the fraction of the total number of samples used per tree for learning.

param.name: RF_REPLACE
param.label: Sample with Replacement
param.help: Sample from training population with or without replacement?

param.name: RF_SPLIT_MIN_SIZE
param.label: Minimum Node Split Size
param.help: Number of examples required for a node to be split. Choose 1 for complete growing.

param.name: RF_STRATIFICATION
param.label: Stratification
param.help: Specifies stratification strategy. Either none, equal amount of class samples, or proportional to fraction of class samples.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.
